DOC.brief_summary: This pilot study evaluate individualized health promotion program people mental illness receiving service mental health center Keene , NH . The study test follow hypothesis : Hypothesis 1 : Compared baseline ( pre-study ) level , participant In SHAPE program demonstrate increase physical activity indicate self-report observed measure . Hypothesis 2 : Compared baseline ( pre-study ) level , participant In SHAPE program demonstrate improve fitness health status indicate great capacity 6-minute walk test , one mile walk test , weight body composition , flexibility index . The following secondary ( exploratory ) hypotheses consider : Compared baseline ( pre-study ) level , participant In SHAPE program demonstrate improve subjective health status , quality life , mood , self-efficacy . In addition , participant demonstrate improve cardiovascular fitness indicate low pulse rate blood pressure .
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation Health Promotion Intervention Persons With Mental Illness
DOC.detailed_description: The In SHAPE program aim improve physical fitness health person mental illness . Participants program assign health mentor assess individual lifestyle habit health status , identifies goal lifestyle change , serve motivator physical trainer . The individualized component In SHAPE program supplement group-level positive reinforcement motivational incentive . This evaluation project systematically evaluate In SHAPE health promotion intervention .
DOC.criteria: Age 18 old , enrol In SHAPE program . Mental illness Receiving mental health service 3 month longer Voluntary inform consent guardian consent Signed letter permission participate physician individual history medical illness indication health problem evaluation Inability give informed , voluntary consent . Primary diagnosis dementia diagnosis psychiatric disorder secondary medical condition . Comorbid dementia indicate MMSE score < 20 . Exclusion eligibility determine participant 's physician due medical contraindication ( e.g. , recent myocardial infarction , stroke ( thrombotic embolic ) , uncontrolled insulindependent diabetes ) .
